title: Portrait of Robert W. Barnett
Scopenote: Portrait of Robert W. Barnett used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Barnett.

title: Portrait of Nathan M. Becker
Scopenote: Nathan M. Becker, economic adviser, Coordinator of Information, Board of Economic Warfare, and US Department of State, 1941-47; and economic adviser, General Staff US-UN Forces, Korea, 1952-53. Donor: Nathan M. Becker

title: Portrait of Loy Henderson
Scopenote: Portrait of Loy Henderson, Director for Near East, Africa, and Southern Asia, Department of State.

title: Portrait of Loy W. Henderson
Scopenote: Loy W. Henderson, career in the United States Department of State, 1922-60. Among many assignments served as Director, Near Eastern and African Affairs, 1946-48; Ambassador to India, 1948-51; and Ambassador to Iran, 1951-55.

title: Portrait of Joseph Satterthwaite
Scopenote: Portrait of Joseph C. Satterthwaite that was used with his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of Shaw Livermore
Scopenote: Portrait of Shaw Livermore that was used with his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Livermore.

title: Portrait of Russell Riley
Scopenote: Portrait of Russell Riley that was used with his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of E. Allan Lightner, Jr
Scopenote: E. Allan Lightner, Jr., Assistant Chief, 1945-47, and Associate Chief, 1947-48, of the Central European Affairs Division, Department of State; Deputy Director, Office of Political Affairs, U.S. High Commission, Frankfurt, Germany, 1949-51; and Deputy Chief of Mission and Counselor of the American Embassy, Korea, 1951-53.

title: Portrait of Arthur Ringwalt
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Arthur Ringwalt that was used with his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of Charles Saltzman
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Charles E. Saltzman that was used with his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of J. Wesley Adams
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of J. Wesley Adams used in his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of August Maffry
Scopenote: Portrait of August Maffry that was used in conjunction with his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of Roman L. Horne
Scopenote: Portrait of Roman L. Horne seated at a desk which was used in his oral history interview.  Donor: Mr. Horne.

title: Portrait of Winthrop G. Brown
Scopenote: Winthrop G. Brown, served as executive officer, Harriman Mission, U.S. Embassy, London, 1941-43; U.S. Lend-Lease Mission to India, 1943; executive officer, Mission for Economic Affairs, U.S. Embassy, London, 1943-45; chief, Division of Commercial Policy, United States Department of State, Washington, 1945-48; acting director, Office of International Trade Policy, 1947-48, director, 1948-50; director, Office of International Materials Policy, 1950-52; and deputy to minister for economic affairs, U.S. Embassy, London, 1952-55. In addition to other posts subsequent to the Truman period he served as U.S. Ambassador to Laos, 1960-62, and as U.S. Ambassador to Korea, 1964-67.

title: Portrait of Willis C. Armstrong
Scopenote: Portrait of Willis C. Armstrong used in his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of Arthur N. Young
Scopenote: Arthur N. Young, economist and financial expert, beginning in 1912, principally as an adviser to the U.S. Government and to the governments of various other countries, including service as an economic adviser in the U.S. Department of State, 1922-28; financial adviser to the Chinese Government and to the Central Bank of China, 1929-46; a member of the Chinese delegation to Bretton Woods financial conference, 1944; director of Point IV program in Saudi Arabia, 1951-52; and financial adviser and chief of financial mission to Saudi Arabia, 1951-52.

title: Portrait of O. Edmund Clubb
Scopenote: Profile portrait of O. Edmund Clubb sitting at a desk looking at papers. This image was used in conjunction with his oral history interview.  Donor: O. Edmund Clubb.

title: Portrait of Anna Lord Strauss
Scopenote: Portrait of Anna Lord Strauss used in her oral history interview.  She was a member of the President's Commission on Internal Security and Individual Rights and President of the League of Women Voters from 1944-1950.  Donor: Ms. Strauss.

title: Portrait of John M. Leddy
Scopenote: Portrait of John M. Leddy that was used in conjunction with his oral history interview.  Donor: John M. Leddy.

title: Portrait of Donald C. Blaisdell
Scopenote: Donald C. Blaisdell, Divisional assistant, assistant division chief, associate division chief, U.S. Department of State, 1941-47; special assistant, Bureau of United Nations Affairs, 1947-51; U.S. representative for International Organization Affairs, Geneva, Switzerland, 1951-53.

title: Portrait of Edward S. Mason
Scopenote: Edward S. Mason, Deputy to the Assistant Secretary of State for Economic Affairs, U.S. Department of State, 1945; economic consultant, Department of State, 1946-47; chief economic adviser, Moscow Conference, 1947; and member of Materials Policy Commission, 1951-52.

title: Portrait of John D. Hickerson
Scopenote: John D. Hickerson, Director for European Affairs, U.S. Department of State, 1947-49; Assistant Secretary of State, 1949-53; member Permanent Joint Board on Defense, U.S. and Canada, 1940-46; and alternate representative, U.S. delegation 4th UN General Assembly, 1949. Later Ambassador to Finland, 1955-60, and to the Philippines, 1960-61.

title: Crowds at the Republican National Convention
Scopenote: Crowds of delegates at the 1948 Republican National Convention, demonstrating their support for the nomination of Governor Thomas E. Dewey of New York.  In the lower left corner is a placard favoring Robert Taft for the nomination.  Original of this photo in the University of Rochester Library, where the papers of Thomas E. Dewey are held.

title: President Truman and Governor Dewey
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) shakes hands with Governor Thomas E. Dewey, Republican Presidential nominee, during dedication ceremonies at the New York International Airport (which became Idlewild Airport).  In the background are (left to right): New York City Mayor William O'Dwyer; Colonel Robert Landry, the President's Air Aide; and New York City Postmaster Albert Goldman.  Donor: Gordon H. Cole, The Machinist

title: President Truman at podium, addressing the Columbia Scholastic Press Association convention
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman at podium addressing 3,000 student editors at the Columbia Scholastic Press Association convention at the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel in New York City.  The Chief Executive interrupted his Key West, Florida vacation to deliver the special 15-minute speech to the young people.  The brief address was broadcast and televised.  Donor:  Gordon H. Cole, THE MACHINIST

title: President Truman Greets Beate Zylka
Scopenote: The last family to immigrate to the United States under the Displaced Persons Act of 1948 visits President Harry S. Truman in the Rose Garden of the White House. Beate Zylka (3) was a little shy as she approached President Truman. Her sister, Ursula Zylka (6), is mostly obscured by the president. Their mother, Ursula Zylka, stands next to the president. Their father, Josef Zylka, stands next to Mrs. Zylka. John W. Gibson, Chairman of the Displaced Persons Commission, stands behind Mr. and Mrs. Zylka. George Mardikian, President of the American National Committee to Aid Homeless Armenians, stands in the back left corner, second from left. All others are unidentified. The family immigrated from Poland.

title: President Harry S. Truman With Medal of Honor Recipients
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman congratulates two United States Army men who have just been presented the Congressional Medal of Honor. They are Corporal Jerry K. Crump (left), Forest City, North Carolina and Corporal Ronald E. Rosser (right), Crooksville, Ohio.  Both men received the honor for heroism in Korea. The award ceremony took place at the White House. Others in the background are unidentified.

title: President Truman Receives New Bible From Dr. Weigle
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman (left) accepts a new Revised Standard Version of the Bible from Dean Emeritus of the Yale Divinity School, Dr. Luther A. Weigle (right), in a Rose Garden ceremony at the White House. Dr. Weigle gave the book on behalf of the National Council of Churches as the chairman of the American Standard Bible Committee. Fifteen years of labor by 32 Protestant scholars went into the crafting of the RSV Bible, which was written in contemporary language. Other people are unidentified.

title: Harry and Margaret Truman
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (left) is met at New York City's La Guardia Airport by daughter Margaret Truman.  Truman came to New York City to address the sixtieth annual Roosevelt Day Dinner.

title: Truman and Kennedy
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) visits with President John F. Kennedy at the White House.  Truman was in Washington, D. C. to attend a dinner marking the 20th anniversary of the founding of the War Investigating Committee which he headed while in the Senate.

title: Portrait of Richard D. Weigle
Scopenote: Portrait of Richard D. Weigle that was used in his oral history interview.

title: Truman at a Wallace Family Picnic
Scopenote: Left to right: May (Mrs. George) Wallace, Harry S. Truman, Bess Wallace, Natalie (Mrs. Frank) Wallace, and Mr. Frank Wallace posing for a photograph during a picnic.  Donated by Mrs. George Wallace, 1975.

title: Portrait of Josiah E. DuBois
Scopenote: Portrait of Josiah E. DuBois used in his oral history interview.

title: Portrait of Bernard Bernstein
Scopenote: Portrait photograph of Bernard Bernstein for use in the oral history project of the Library. Bernard Bernstein,  Director, Finance Division and Division of Investigation of Cartels and External Assets, U.S. Group Control Commission for Germany, 1944-45.

title: Earl Warren and Thomas Dewey
Scopenote: Republican presidential nominee Thomas E. Dewey (right) and vice-presidential nominee Earl Warren, Governor of California, pose together.

title: Thomas E. Dewey and family
Scopenote: On the eve of the balloting at the Republican National Convention, Governor Thomas E. Dewey and Mrs. Frances E. Dewey, with their sons Thomas, 15 (left) and John, 12, sit for an informal portrait in their suite at the Bellevue-Stratford.

title: Thomas Dewey accepting Republican nomination
Scopenote: With his wife, Mrs. Frances E. Dewey, beside him, Governor Thomas E. Dewey of New York waves to crowds as he takes the platform for his speech accepting the Republican Presidential nomination.

title: Portrait of Edwin W. Martin
Scopenote: Edwin W. Martin, vice consul, Hamilton, Bermuda, 1941-44, Leopoldville, Belgian Congo, 1944, Peiping, China, 1946-48, Hankow, China, 1948-49; consul, Taipei, Formosa, 1949-50; consul, also second Secretary of Embassy, Rangoon, Burma, 1950-51; with Department of State, Washington, 1952-, deputy director, Office Chinese Affairs, 1953; director, Office Chinese Affairs, 1958-61; and Ambassador to Burma, 1971-73.

title: Portrait of Charles P. Kindleberger
Scopenote: Charles P. Kindleberger, Economist with the Office of Strategic Services, 1942-44, 1945; chief, Division German and Austrian Economic Affairs, Department of State, Washington, 1945-48; and Intelligence Officer, 12th U.S. Army group, 1944-45.

title: President Truman whistlestop campaigning in Missoula, Montana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman whistlestop campaigning in Missoula, Montana.  This photo was donated by E. E. Jeffers, who has donated his rights to the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: President Truman whistlestop campaigning in Missoula, Montana
Scopenote: President Harry S. Truman whistlestop campaigning in Missoula, Montana.  Donated by E. E. Jeffers, who has donated his rights to the Harry S. Truman Library.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Playing Poker
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) sits at a poker table with other men. With him are Hugh J. Curran, businessman and developer of North Kansas City (left), and Tom L. Evans (second from right). The photos were taken without any of them actually knowing they were being photographed. They are at the 822 Club in Kansas City, Missouri.   From: David D. Lloyd

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Plays Poker
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman (right) sits at a poker table with other men. With him are Hugh J. Curran, businessman and developer of North Kansas City (left), and Tom L. Evans (second from right). The photos were taken without any of them actually knowing they were being photographed. They are at the 822 Club in Kansas City, Missouri.

title: Former President Harry S. Truman Playing Poker
Scopenote: Former President Harry S. Truman sits at a poker table with other men.  With him are Hugh J. Curran, businessman and developer of North Kansas City and Tom L. Evans (left of Mr. Truman).  The photos were taken without any of them actually knowing they were being photographed. They are at the 822 Club in Kansas City, Missouri. The donor is David D. Lloyd.

title: Portrait of Benjamin Hulley
Scopenote: Portrait of Benjamin M. Hulley that was used with his oral history interview. This photo was taken in Helsinki, Finland.

title: Portrait of Durward Sandifer
Scopenote: Portrait of Durward V. Sandifer that was used with his oral history interview.
